reviews.sentence: Jim Parker. Our group Tour de Force. A charity Cycling Group with 250 people have stayed at Melville Mariot for the past 3 years. Booking both sleeping rooms 150 at a time and banquets. The Melville Mariot have alwAys treated us as family every year. From their sales staff to doormen are ALWAYS ready to help out in anyway they canWe will continue to stay with this hotel Special attention specialist Lorraine Klaper in saleshas been our contact and without her attention to detail style makes our job with riders a pleasure.

Amazing Stay. Me and my family had an amazing time visiting family and staying in this hotel while doing it Tim the front desk manager was one of the most amazing workers I have ever seen he gave us directions to the airshow we meet some of the pilots while we were there and the food at Bistro 49 was amazing.

Exceptional customer service. From the moment I arrived till the moment I departed I felt like a VIP because of the superior attention to detail and outstanding customer service. Tim R took care of each of my business needs with complete follow through. When I had a small snafu in the restaurant Michael N and Amir made sure all was correct and made right. Truly VIP attention was given by the entire staff to this small customer. The computer did not allow me to print a business communication Harmony F and TIm R found a way to send the e mail to the Hotel and then print each item. Jose M from delivered my room service and set me up for ease of use. I am disabled he was a true blessing. Corine was out banquet manger for 2 days and kept her eye on our needs while juggling many many other venues. This is my second time at this property Melville Mariot. I look forward to returning for future business AND would happily bring my family and friends. The staff of this entire property surround you with exceptional professionalism nurturing spirit and unyielding kindness. My best wishes for your continued success. Dr AT.

Hosted my family reunion here. I hosted my family reunion here from 812 814. The whole staff is truly dedicated to making sure your experience is excellent. The spread on Friday was beautiful. The banquet on Saturday was exquisite. Ilene Linda Rhea Scott and Tahisha and even Mohammed. all made our experience great. There were many other staff members of whom I would like to be able to recall but to be honest they were all amazing. By Saturday afternoon I began hearing how thoroughly everyone was enjoying themselves. Thank you Melville Mariot for your help in making our bi annual family reunion a success.

Loved it. Will be back. We had a lovely time staying at the Melvile Mariot. From the minute we walked in we were greeted with genuine smiles from staff at the reception check in desk. It was a special surprise anniversary trip weekend for hubby to go to the Barclays Cup. Jhanet and Ria were just wonderful they made sure we had a memorable stay and we can not thank them enough for the complimentary extras that made our stay amazing they were just lovely. Thank you so muchWe had a concierge king room on the 4th floor it was a very quiet floor considering the hotel was full with people staying for the Barclays. The view of the sunset was just beautiful. Our room was very quiet and clean. Very comfy bed. I want the pillows and linens. The resturaunt was totally our style modern contemporary with a very relaxing atmosphere menu had a good variety service was a little slow at first but our waiter sorry I forgot your name was great he was attentive did not keep interrupting our dinner. We enjoyed our meal and when friends came to join they were warmly welcomed. We love the style in this part of the hotel. The lobby was very nice too however the atrium was just strange I think it is the carpet it did not quite go with the style of the front desk and lounge resturant. The pool looked very clean although we were too late for a swim as it closed at 10pm. Breakfast was of the best we have had. Fresh cooked omelette to order and the hot buffet was delicious our waitress Maria was so attentive and made us feel very special. We are happy to have found a really nice hotel with staff really committed to making our stay a fabulous one it made our anniversary trip that much more special. We will definitely be back for the next golf tournament.

Wedding Weekend. We used this hotel for our group during the weekend of my wedding. We accounted for a large number of rooms in the hotel and not one complaint that I am aware of. They allowed us to use open space for gathering and hanging out they were nothing but kind about it. When we used the shuttle for the rehearsal dinner Ilene even came over on the first run to help bring guests back which was great for some guests who were unable to step up onto the shuttle. Food was great bar service was good and the staff was super friendly and always acknowledged our group event.

Five Plus Rating. The Mariot Melville is the absolute best among all hotels in its class bar none. Our recent stay was incredible. Rooms decor restaurant all superior. But their best quality was the friendliness and competency of the staff. All were top notch the front desk housekeeping restaurant maintenance workers everyone. We will make the Mariot Melville the destination for our annual family stay on Long Island.

Great staff pool for the kids. Stayed recently for a family event. The staff is wonderful and accommodating. The pool hours were perfect for my kids post and pre long car rides to and from home. The rooms were large and clean. They have cribs. The restaurant and lounge updates are very nice cozy and beg to be sat in with large groups of family or friends. Food prices are average for hotel a happy hour would have been nice. Lobby has coffee and water all day.

No sleep. Stayed at this hotel on Saturday night. Hotel was filled with families of sport tournaments. You can imagine the activity of 10 12 yr olds running through halls lobby and at the pool. I have kids and do n’t have a problem with that. But when the hotel allows parents to “ tailgate ” in the hotel lobby and open spaces until 2am. it goes to far. By tailgate I mean coolers full of booze throughout the pool area and lobby corn hole set up in the lobby beer bottles can all over. The noise was ridiculous. Hotel knows it ’s a problem as they have these policy signs made and placed all over. but they do zero to enforce. Worse then the hotel were the parents. I politely asked them a couple times to take the party elsewhere or keep it down and they were obnoxious in return. They were from MA. that ’s all you have to know.

Here for Business. I was in town for a week dealing with work where I was spending 8 10 hours a day in a dirty warehouse. the one thing I am looking in a hotel on these trips is for it to be clean quiet a easy to get in and out of and hopefully good food. I have to say this hotel had all of those really what surprised me was the quality of the food the hotel is a bit remote so after a long day I did not feel like driving 15 minutes to get food and really enjoyed the options at the lobby restaurant. The hotel is a large wide U shape so if you have a far room plan on walking for bit but I am fine with that. Staff was great very helpful when I had an issue with my TV it was fixed quickly. The club room was nice for a quick respite if you have status its worthwhile to check out. Overall a great spot for a work trip highly recommended if you are in the area.

Great overall. Just wish it was quieter. This was my second time staying here and the room was great as before. They gave me a king room as I requested and also allowed for late check out which I greatly appreciated. I’m not sure if there was a wedding or party but some guests on the floor were very loud for 4 5 hrs even after quiet hours. Not the hotels fault but was a bit unpleasant seeing that my fiancé and I got a room for a quiet getaway.

Screaming and yelling till 130 am 12 hours of children and adaults running and screaming in the halls on 2 floors playing hide n seek 40 teen girls and boys partying in 1 room constantly spilling into the hallway. Security and staff unwilling unable to control what was occuring. Not a place you go for rest.
Hotel was not bad but the security is horrible there is a big group of children and teenagers were running away the hallway an.

One of the most horrific experiences I ’ve had in my entire life staying at a hotel. On check in there were children running and screaming all over the hotel making it impossible to hear the screaming could be heard in the hotel rooms as our family checked into three separate rooms. We make it a habit to always check the sheets and mattresses of every hotel we stay in because bed bugs can be very hard to get rid of. We found bugs crawling blood and shells. In all the hotel rooms we ’ve checked we ’ve never seen this. We were horrified and checked out immediately. The hotel was accommodating with this but people should know what ’s going on and what to be looking for if they stay at this hotel. Beware.

Rude Staff. I ’ve stayed at the Melville Mariot a few times since 2012 the service has n’t always been great but my most recent stay has been horrible I just witnessed the concierge Christopher interrupt a church mid prayer during an annual retreat which the hotel has hosted 4 years running. The concierge actually walked in and asked that the praying minister stop using his microphone and wrap up while he was still within the allotted time the church had paid for. I found the lack of professionalism and disregard for those visiting with the church appalling especially since there were large groups at the bar being quite rowdy. I will happily take my business elsewhere.
